column11: Review Text
When my friends and visited, it was off season, so the waves were too rough to swim in. However, the one constant is that the Kalutara beach is a wonderful place to watch the sunset.

We went to see the beautiful beach of Kalutara at the beginning of February. On the day we came to spend a holiday at the tangerine beach Hotel . The Green sea behind the tangerine beach was beautiful but looked very rough.. That area is not suitable for swimming. We spent a lot of time on the beach despite the hot sun. The sea area was splashed with green color and a special number of shells could be seen all over the beach.

Unfortunately, a lot of parts of the Kalutara North Beach were swiped away after a flood a few years ago. The remaining parts are quite narrow and dirty. An other problem were pushy sellers for souvenirs and excursions. So you nearly couldn't find a quiet minute. And after all, the rough sea made swimming impossible. So it was not a good experience and we had to go to other beaches like Bentota.

Superb, very long beach. Very clean sand from coconut trees all along and in abundance. The sea is very beautiful, not clear at all because of fine sand. No algae. Permanently very big waves which remain quite dangerous for those not used to it. Fairly strong currents remind you of your order. We walk quite far but you still have to be a good swimmer to get 100 meters away.

There is no longer a beach here at all. It‚Äôs been washed away by the sea. There is only one small section of beach which is accessible via very slippery sandbags that have been made into steps not accessible for people in wheelchairs or with disabilities. Also the sea is extremely rough and has a big undercurrent, so do not go into it at all above the knee as you will be swept out very very quickly indeed.

We stayed in a hotel on Kalutara Beach. Sunny beach, steep waves. We met a cool local guy, Sampat, on the beach there. He told a lot of interesting things about Sri Lanka, helped on the ground - what, where it‚Äôs more profitable to buy, how to get there, helped organize trips. We also ordered huge, delicious, freshly cooked shrimp and langoustines from him. (if you need inst Sampath @mendissampath)
Unfortunately, there is actually no beach here. It has been washed away. The sea is very rough here. You have to go further south. The photo is definitely older.

Doesn't have official parking spots for vehicles. So parking is at risk of your own. Sand and beaches are mostly with garbage. Not an ideal place for a swim. Even though there are lifeguard stations, only ghosts & ghouls work in them. Kids attractions, such as play areas (although adult couples seem to have to enjoy them rather than children) & objects are available.

As a result, they are polluted with plastics and flotsam. Coarse sand/fine gravel is uncomfortable to walk on. The shoreline often slopes rapidly to the sea, which is prone to large waves and undercurrents. Not recommended for very young and/or weak swimmers.

column8: Obly clean in front of Royal Palms and Tangerine
column11: In front of the two hotels Royal Palms Beach and Tangerine, the beach is properly clean. North of these hotels, very dirty and no cleaning whatsoever it seems. Kalutara administration has a huge potential for improvement if they are really keen on attracting tourists.

this is a quite beach. not so many crowded there. lot of seafood restaurant out there. you can plan your all island tour from this beach. lot of tour guides you can meet at the beach. specially you can arrange your Yala National Park tour from there with Spotting Trails Safari Company.
The beach is in a poor  and neglected state. Only good for walks nothing  else. Its better to look for other better beaches around.

I found the hotel to be friendly and there was nothing that was to much trouble. The room was immaculate everyday and comfortable.  The view was stunning  from the room and my favourite part of the day was watching the sun go down from the balcony. The food was superb.. I especially enjoyed my egg hoppers in the morning ... the chefs do a wonderful job and I had no complaints about choice ... the traditional food was wonderful also. The bar staff were always happy to speak with you and were very accommodating letting my husband watch cricket .. there was plenty of tea and coffee available which I enjoyed as I cant drink beer 24/7 My highest praise goes to the lovely  pool guys . I have arthritis and struggle shifting sunbeds , every day they made sure I was ok and had a sun bed and plenty of shade .. I cant thank them enough.. Our rep Nigel was very informative and sorted out a great trip for us . The only reason it didn't get the full 5 stars was continually being pestered on the beach .. my husband could cope with the banter but it got draining by the second week and it's not nice to be stared at when all you want to do is get some peace looking at the sea .. I do understand they have to make a living.. Thank you for a lovely stay

Lovely beach but not excellent - very strong waves and currents at different times of the day - red flags used when it‚Äôs not safe. Steep drop off at the waters edge and then a sand bar for about 15m. By the water the beach is sloped and not flat - there is a flat sandy area further back from the waterfront.
Beautiful kalido beach now in dilapidated state.thease days government try to reinstate the beach pumping sand from sea.

The beach is very nice and clean with loads of sea shells in the sand. There are big stones near the beach which makes it very interesting to watch while high tide. The best view is during sunrise and sunset. If you are staying in Anantara or Avani hotel at Kaluthara, you can enjoy their private Kaluthara beach. Must go beach if you love to relax.
sparse with people as there are not so many hotels along the beaches.  In the morning you see the fishermen coming in from the sea and you meet some cows that seem to stay close at night.
Long, reasonably clean and empty. A few colourful fishing boats to photograph and the occasional place for light refreshment - Sri Lankan style

Staying at Mermaid Hotel on the edge of Kalutara Beach. Long sandy beach with breaking waves. Fairly safe if you swim within your depth. Reasonably clean beach but, of course, you also have to cope with a number of beach vendors (and their dogs!).
Nice sandy beach to walk on. Not too bothered by hawkers who tend to congregate around the entrances to the hotels.
Problems caused by the sea earlier on so now putting in retaining wall to stop anymore erosion. Beautiful sunsets ü•∞

Very dirty and they need to sort there pollution out ! The fisherman fish with there nets brining in all of the rubbish which is left on the beach ! Just pick it up ! But other than that nice sand and clear ocean
Very clean beach with amazing sunsets and lots of shells to collect and find - near the Avani and Anantara hotel and lots of Cafe outlets off the beach as well

A beautiful beach that offers miles of golden sand. Near the hotels you can find restaurants but you can be bothered by beach sellers and guides offering tours. Be polte but firm and they'll leave you alone. A nice beach for sunbathing if that's your thing but you would need to be a really good swimmer to swim there. Large waves that break noisily onto a steeply shelving shore means that you'll need to shout to make yourself heard. If you venture into the water when the surf's up,make sure you're with someone because the undertow is evil and will take you right off your feet in a surprisingly shallow amount of water.

The beach is not the cleanest which is a shame as it would be lovely otherwise, there is lots of rubbish around, there are a number of poor street dogs roaming around too. You wouldn't want to sunbath on the beach, also the sea is quite rough especially after 12 midday, the rip tide current is really strong and the beach dips down so if your a weak swimmer you could struggle, we did get to see some beautiful sunsets on the beach

Great beach....... powerful big waves and currents. Lots of drift wood....... great beach to walk along.Red flags and many swimming in select areas......... so don‚Äôt be fooled..... be careful. Enjoy your holiday in Sri Lanka

We stayed at the Mermaid Hotel and from our room beach looked lovely. On our first walk in morning going south we found beach hard going for walking, it‚Äôs tilts too unevenly so you are walking lob sided we found, also with this being a fishing town quite a bit of diesel spillage and other rubbish along the way. Next walk we went in opposite direction and found the same. Hotel Mermaid cleans the beach right outside but obviously not the full stretch

Beautiful Kalutara beach. Very clean and well kept. It was a pleasure to watch the early Fishermen in the morning pull up there boats on this lovely beach. Lots of local sellers directly outside hotel on the beach selling beautiful Sri Lankan beach wraparounds. Stunning place to just sit and think and watch the roller waves wash in.
it is nice place to relax.but is it slowly go down.need to clean the beach. Otherwise beach is good.
Not very clean. Bathing not recommended. This might be different in privately maintained beaches if they are properly looked after by the hotels.

The beach is not clean nor well kept in this area in general. Certain big hotels do maintain the beach by its premises but not all hotels do this. The sea itself is generally rough. Not recommended for bathing/ swimming.
Nice sandy beach but very narrow  no sunbeds allowed on beach or chairs sea very tough large waves  good evening stroll
Amazing resort and people. Extremely helpful and serve with enthusiam. Whenever needed, they are always there.!

Long beautiful almost deserted beach lined with palm trees. How come you are all alone most of the time? Because the water is not safe to swim in, so be aware of high waves and strong currents. Well worth a stroll anyway and you can get your feet wet and still be safe. But I would not recommend swiming for everyone, only strong swimmers. Definately not for small children.
Its a nice and clean beach and one can easily walk barefoot on the fine sand...Although the waves were very tricky during our visit, it was still worthwhile..
Lovely scenery, beautiful sand but even as a good swimmer, I did not dare swim in the water, the waves were too rough!
Stayed at Tangerine Hotel - just a few meters walk to shore - wonderful waves and great beach! Life guards are on duty - the sea is suitable for swimmers..
Best time to stroll along this beach is early morning when there are not the local people trying to sell you something, Tide and undercurrent make it not the safest of places for swimming.

Stayed at a hotel on this beach for a week after touring Sri Lanka. An impressive sandy beach, quite exhilarating to visit and walk along. However, it  can be very dangerous due to the steeply sloping beach and strong undercurrents. When we visited the prevailing winds meant that there was no time for safe bathing as tides and waves were very high. The hotel had security/lifeguards who clearly advised about going into the sea. Sadly there seemed to be no daily clear up of the beach and so a certain amount of driftwood  at the high water mark. The beach is a public area and you are readily/rapidly approached by local people trying to sell wares or local services, as well as occasional beggars. They do not cross the fences/gates into the hotel grounds, but wait on the beach ready to approach any guests who do go out. Although a bit of hassle, clearly declining all offers got the message across and you were eventually left in peace¬∑ There are some cafes/businesses accessing the beach. We visited one  selling hand carved wooden wares. They were beautiful. The owner took great delight in showing off the products that he or his apprentices had made and  prepared. There was no real hassle in the workshop and a very genuine warmth from the owner and his wife, as well as a justifiable pride in their products. Overall a beautiful beach, but not practical if you were looking to swim and sunbathe, due to the wild seas, the lack of sunbathing facilities and continuing approaches from locals.
disappointing...the sea is dirty. it is better going to Galle's beaches then in kalutara. the seaside in anantara kalutara resort is better and nice because very clean
The beach is not that crowded, it is clean and peaceful. If you are in this area it is worth a visit.

The beach looks ok from a distance, but it is not sandy, it is rough grit and not clean with dog excrement, litter and worse still broken glass.  Shoes are definitely required for any strolls on the beach.
Here are photos of the beach outside Tangerine resort today. it has been like this since we arrived on Sunday.
Butifull unmolested beach great for a stroll ,my Wife and I used to go down there for a swim everyday the sea can get rough so be aware of this.some litter scattered about which should be cleaned up.
It was brilliant just sitting eating your meal looking out at the beachfront when we was on our way to the hotel from the airport was a elephant just walking at the side of the road it was amazing.

The beach is accessible from a number of points. Do not be put off by hotels fronting the beach - it is public access so you can use it for the full length. Beware, there can be strong currents which can trick even a strong swimmer so stay on the sandy shelf where you can stand.
Great for walking this stretch of coast. Sea can be rough and there is a rip currant. Red flags are often used.

I quite liked the beach. It was clean and the current was fine. Only thing is its not clear water.Other than that it was good for jogging and playing around with the waves. gd view of sunset.Gd waves and not so deep but not suitable for kids to go far,around and near to the shores are fine.

Got to say very disappointed, there are no sun loungers for sun bathing, no parasols for protection from the sun. The sea is fairly rough with undercurrent, so ideal for snorkeling and probably not children. Numerous dogs around , never caused a problem but not everyone‚Äôs cup of tea. Also for the 1st few days be prepared for traders trying to sell excursions etc
The beach has many rips. The beachboys are friendly. But it is beautiful waving beach.  But to sunbath ,you have looked for right place
Not very suitable for young children as it is quite a step beach. They are working on this and I do look forward to seeing the results.
Beach is not taken care of well. Full of dog poo and of-course lots of stray dogs. Sometimes they are barking or fighting spoiling the little serenity you feel there. Not my cup of tea.
This beach is long, clean and quiet, perfect for walking, sun bathing and swimming, be careful the waves are big
Lovely. Easy access, near to hotel entrance, rear. Lots of interest.within easy walking distance of the neighbouring Hotels

The beach can be dirty in places, but usually OK near to hotels. The surf can be fun, through to outright dangerous and you should have your wits about you at all times. These are not the type of beaches that make lasting Sri Lankan memories.
Great way to spend an afternoon walking on the sea shore as the sun sets. Sometimes you may even see cows wandering on the shore
A good beach and all the hotels clean their part of the beach. Cows wander along the beach at sunset going somewhere. The sea can be strong and should be treated with respect.
Children love the beach and so do we. May it be a warm sunny day or cool evening, watching the sun set, it takes all your cares away. Enjoy the beach front at hotel mermaid!
The waves sometimes were up to 2 meters, but some days it was almost tight. That‚Äôs the beach closing to the hotels Turyaa, Kamili, Citrus

We really enjoyed walking along the beach (10km) every day. It's so cool that there are hardly any people and you can see different animals and also the fishermen in the morning. Nevertheless we would not recommend Kalutara beach to people who enjoy swimming in the sea or lying on the beach. The beach is really dirty (plastic waste, ...) and it's definitely not for kids. The waves are too high, red flag all the time, dangerous currents.
Nice to spend the time after a round trip of the small island of Sri Lanka. Would be nicer it was more cleaner , some areas.

Great clean beach with bars at some hotels you can stop off at. We walked approx 1.5 hour each way along beach from coco beach resort and apart from odd bar owners and spa ladies were left to enjoy the beautiful walk

We were fortunate that the Kalutara beach near our hotel nearby Anantara and AVANI was kept cleaner than other parts of Kalutara area. The beach sand was also a bit more rougher due a strong mix of tiny pebbles, sand and crushed shells.
Nice view with the sunset. Waves were bit rough though. Beach had been ruined a little with rubbish , so people must be more concerned as it destroys the whole beach
Spectacular but not for families - only for strong swimmers. Is a very long beach you can walk along

This beach was at the back of our hotel as soon as you walk out you get haggled by locals for trips meals drinks in the restaurants on the beach and goods the beach is long but red flags always flying cos waves are strong and beach dips down bit dirty in places but a nice walk during the day

Lovely beach, but we traveled at the the wrong time of year to appreciated it! It was shame that the weather has wasjed so much litter up on to the beach, whilst we knew we cold not go into the sea, walking along the beach was difficult with the amount of rubbish. It certainly made us realise how much rubbish and plastic must be in our oceans, sad really.

Great beach to stroll along in the morning. Unfortunately evidence of the oceans plastic issue is here. Needs a beach clean. Not impressed with hotel treated effluent being discharged across the beach from the Turyaa. Effluent should not smell this did!
...but dangerous to swim in  The waves was fare to high when we was there but to walk along the beach is amazing
Clean, wide beaches with golden sand and pleasant water. The sound of the ocean at night is the best sleeping pill.
Very soft sand that you sink into, good fun watching all the crabs fly out in front of you and run for the sea. Lots of people selling goods and tours but all are polite and not pushy.
Hotel Avani had private beach. Enjoyed morning walk and sunset . Although steep but fully secure for quick swim

Very steep banking down to see presumably Man made after tsunami as this hotel was flooded. Quite dirty and lots of dogs around. Very rough sea not recommended for swimming. Some other beaches around the island were better but still disappointing.
lovely beach and lovely local people to chat to   water was a bit rough at this time of year but was expected
Though it is a nice and clean beach but is very dangerous for swim. Just next to our resort, it was good for morning walk.
This location is very attractive and nice , if you wish to spend the day you can take your families there.

the beach looks lovely. it can be a little hard to walk on because it is all broken sea shells .Disappointed  that we could not swim in the sea. Red flag was flying all the time. We went in September, which is not the summer period, so may be a little less calmer in the main season.

The ideal time to visit the long beaches of Kalutara is from September to April where the sea is calm and less waves. The North Area is more touristic and the Kalutara town and calido beach is more popular with locals. the Kalu Ganga also flows and meets the Indian Ocean in Kalutara.

A clean and neat beach, with space to enjoy without being bothered. The place is good for families and couples and was quite safe when we travelled. The best part was there was no littering of any kind
Usually the beach in kalutara is on the rough side and you need to be careful if you're bathing at the beach. and it's getting even worse during May to Sep period ..
Lovely beach. We enjoied lot. We spent there for long hours but not fed up. Nice beach to visit. Highly recomended

Cycling Tours in Sri Lanka‚Äôs one day excursions let you explore a smaller area of the country than the longer cycling holidays, but they can be just as rewarding, given within  limited time. Our expert  guides will take you to see Sri Lanka‚Äôs major cities that will excite or on nature trails that will leave you for more longer period .
Very steep there was no way I would swim in this sea too rough and a steep ledge which would be a risk for anyone with a mobility issue.
The beach on this side of the island is all you would want if the sea was calmer.  During our two weeks the red flag flew every day . Dont risk it

Comparing to south coast beaches, this is a mediocre and polluted beach with nothing much going on. Filled with locals and therefore garbages it is not recommended to foreigners. Sea is rough and not suited for water activities.
Maybe it was a bad time of the year but this beach was not impressive. It was dirty and left untended by the abutting hotels, bars, commercial enterprises, etc. It could be so much nicer.

Because it is offseason, the beach is more violent. It is a great place for a stroll. If you want to go swiming in the summer months, xatch out for the undertow. There are more beautiful beaches in Sri Lanka, hence four stars.

I happened stay @ Royal coco resort for two days during my Shri Lanka travel in April 2017 Since the resort is lactated in the vicinity of Kalutara Beach ,I took a round of the beach both in the evening and night for two days continuously. The tourists  from the European countries were found to enjoy uncrowded beach.There are some restaurants serving sea food on the bank but thy are under thatched roof and attract a few tourists Massage centers are not in a good ambiance so I avoided visiting it.There are some beautiful trees and overall the beach is clean I would rate it as a reasonably good place to visit during travel to Shri Lanka. That does not mean one should go there specially.It could be included in the itinerary
Unfortunayely I was in low season, so, I could not manage to swim in the ocean, but loved walking barefoot on golden sands... It's fantastic!
The beach was beautiful and we enjoyed the experience. The beach was very clean and the scenery was mesmerizing. Enjoyed the visit
We were there in low season and the beach was awful and dangerous. It was hard to imagine in high season it would be much better.
The coast is not good to visit even for a walk.Not a place to stop.Not a tourist attraction. Drive further South for  better beaches.
Due to it being rainy season the beach was covered in debris. Due to current you werent able to go in the sea. Walked along beach a couple of times but it wasn't anything special.
We visited Kaluthara beach last year and couldn't find a clean spot to take a photo. It was very unclean.

I visited this area for an overnight stay. I‚Äôm glad I didn‚Äôt stay any longer. Very disheartening seeing the beaches with so much rubbish. Not sure if most of it washed ashore or whether stuff was dumped there by locals. Either way, it was disgraceful. Not somewhere you would want to pull up a towel for a sun bake on the beach. Sri Lanka is beautiful but the beaches on east and west coast are well below an acceptable level.
The beach is not safe so swimming so the best thing about this lovely beach is that there r few tourists on sun beds it is just a fabulous deserted beach.
Had  great  stay  and enjoyed  alot.. The  place  is very  good. The view  from the room  is great..Clean beach with always  safe guard üíÇ.

Kalutara is a located in Western Province of Sri Lanka. But not close to Colombo. It's 1-1.30 hour drive (considering traffic). IF you are visiting Sri Lanka you can stay in Kalutara hotel and enjoy beach. It is somewhat okay. Once Kalutara had a nice beach called "Kalido/Calido" with sand and trees covering the land and guiding it. But now it's destroyed. But the beach is still there. Around Kalutara there is no much things to do. But if you want a beach getaway this is ideal. No need of a guide. Just go to the beach.

what a great place to visit. saw 2 panthers, 2 bears, ,crocks, wild boar, troops of monkeys and numbers of. birds and small animals. However when we were there the Elephants went on holiday. others saw elephants on the days they went to visit however they never saw the panthers and bears. It looks like luck is the decider. LOVED it
Sea was very rough could not go swimming.sand is quite coarse . There were women there trying to sell dresses and a couple of beggars on beach

Our hotel was alongside Kalutara Beach and we went out onto it most days. The beach was quite clean compared to some I have seen in the Far East - only the odd bit of litter. The sea does look rough and appears to be deep but there is a shelf and once you have  crossed that it becomes very shallow. My children enjoyed jumping the waves and as we were holding them we felt that it was safe enough to do so.

The water is lovely and warm, but there is a treacherous undertow which you have to be very careful of. Not suitable for young children, or frail elderly folk. The sand is very gritty and unpleasant to walk on. The beach slopes quite steeply. Conclusion: nice to look at and listen to, but we stayed near the pool!

We stayed in the North of Kalutara first, the beach was a very long but uncomfortable beach to walk along.  The sand is coarse, sharp sand, like builders sand with patches of black sand along the beach.  The beach shelved down to the rough sea and unless you are a very confident swimmer I wouldn‚Äôt attempt to swim in it! We then stayed in South Kalutara, again the beach was the same sand as was the conditions for swimming in but it was shorter and prettier and hardly any black sand.

A warm sea but rough with a very strong current. Paddle up to your knees but I wouldn‚Äôt recommend swimming. Waves come in big & are often unexpected. The patch outside our hotel (the royal palms beach hotel) was clean in the areas you could see, but a short walk past view at either end reveals litter strewn everywhere. We avoided the beach for this reason. On a plus, the sand is soft & easy to walk on.
Beautiful and wild beach with some enjoyable beer spots for some Lion lager. I wasn't brave enough to go in the sea!

Kalutara beach covers a considerably large area. However the place to visit freely is the Kalido beach area. Very good for morning and evening visits. There are some concerns of peoples mis behaviors and also there are some environmental issues due to ill act of people.
We were staying at the Anantara and had beach access. It was super clean and beautiful to relax and spend the day.

Nice Walk ! Avoid the midday heat - get in and Swim !, see all sorts of wildlife on the beach, pity about the stuff washed up though if you are going swimming there's a bit of a rip current you need to watch out for but the waves are fun to body surf

I enjoyed the stay very much , the staff is so friendly and dedicated , especially ( Bimali & Sayuri) they made our stay the greatest and so comfortable. They are the best The rooms are great , big and super clean , the food is great ,sunset view is the bests
Warm waters brilliant surfs and safe flat silted sands. These beaches are brilliant in the afternoons and remain warm till well past 7. A must visit in the south east areas
Shame about the beach. You can't go swimming because of the current being so strong and also we were really cautious of the Ferrell dogs and the dog mess so we didn't spend much time on the beach.

Really beautiful, course golden sand mixed with some sparkly black soft sand too, really picturesque. Unfortunately here, the locals / tourists / council etc don‚Äôt make any effort to clean the beach up so it does have a lot of trash on the beach and in the ocean too. The waves are prett heavy, dumpy and forceful so not the easiest beach to swim at. All in all, not the best beach in Sri Lanka but certainly not the worst.
Not suitable to swim in due to strong currents, the beach is very dirty with rubbish and the locals swarm you begging for money

The beach is as per the pictures. The sand can be a little rough and where we are there was a slope into the sea which might not be ideal for those with walking difficulties or with small children. We were also advised not to swim in the sea due to strong currents.

Great beach, bit of a dip as you enter the sea with a few small pebbles, but a few yards in you will be on a carpet of sand,Red flag flying most of the time, this is because the current is very strong,big waves
We liked to swim every day(early March),the waves calm down before shores.The beach was clean,sand very hot at noon. The dogs are on beach but if you dont feed them,they dont bore you
Beach is a public beach so only a few sun beds which belonged to the hotel avail. Beach dropped away quickly into the sea and hoteladvised not to swim in the sea.
The sea was always too rough to swim in and the swimming pool was only waist deep. We lived watching the local fisherman.

Stretches for miles so can walk along way, sand ok very black in places and unfortunately very untidy in places with plastic bottles and rubbish. Lots of fishing boats along the way and sometimes you can see the catch of the day been brought in. One or two beach bars dotted around in between hotels. Sea very warm and very rough waves most of the time but although red flags fly most of the time and many parts have no lifeguard on duty it doesn't stop people having fun with mother nature. Not many hawkers either but occasionally you will get a restaurant or bar owner walk miles with you to try and get you into their establishment, just a firm no thank you usually does the trick.
Amazing Beach so stunning would highly reccommend it! Sand is amazing, the sea is amazing just a superb place to visit and see
Beautiful clean beach, lovely warm sea; just be careful of the current though. Time it right and watch the fishermen landing their catch of the day. You can even help too!
The sand is very nice, extra fine, the beach is not very wide, and kind somehow ‚Äúraw‚Äù, it‚Äôs great for walks!

Great sunset views and clean water. But the current is a little strong and you need to be a good swimmer. There also isn‚Äôt much beach as it slopes off quiet sharply making it hard to walk on. We found Bentota was a better beach

The beach looks beautiful, but you can clearly see ow deep it goes in some parts. Unless you are familiar with and can "read" beach conditions, don't take risks especially with children. The current is very strong and can change fast. Make sure you check the colour of the flag before you go in. Sand a bit rough and can hurt soft feet like mine. My husband was find with it. Locals trying to sell you things or services can be annoying as they continue to insist even when you say no.

Many people wander along the beach in either direction, along the surf at the edge of the incredibly warm ocean. Waves can be quite fierce and you must take care of younger children or weak swimmers. In places the beach slopes a fair bit to get into the sea, but , once in, the bottom is flat and hard packed sand, which is lovely to walk on. Tiny crabs dash along the sea fringes, darting int holes in the sand. There are a myriad of tiny sea shells along the waters edge. The sea is very warm and lovely to swim in with care.
This beach is perfect for swimming and walking. It is simply beautiful and unspoiled by people. Very romantic too.

Decent beach, but the sand is very "sharp" so not easy to walk in barefoot. There is a bit of hassle from the locals wanting to sell you stuff as you walk around though. The sea can be very rough, and there are riptides, so be careful if you do venture in
Specially the Calido beach Kalura is attractive as it has both river and see in either-sides of the sand line . I enjoyed this place a lot and foot ball playing
This is a beautiful beach running for miles, however beware of the strong undertow..  scattered along the beach are fishing villages whereyou can help the local fishermen bring the catch to shore.
We were staying at the avani hotel so right on the beach. This beach is amazing, clean, amazing golden sand. Perfect to watch the sunset

The beach is very long and wide and nice to walk along. However the sea was very rough when we were there with a red flag flying most of the time. Apparently the under currents have caught some people out so you may wish to swim just in your hotel pool!
Very clean beach ideal if you want to watch the fishermen setting out dropping their nets returning to beach then pulling their nets back onto the beach when calm waters ideal for swimming
Water and beach are clean. Best for jumping into the waves. Be careful though when not a good swimmer.
Beautiful beach and if you get up early enough you can see them bringing the fish  In.The Mermaid Hotel is located on this beach.I did yoga here at the Mermaid overlooking the ocean,perfect.
This place is about an hours journey from Colombo. The train runs immediately next to the cost. Kautara beach may not be a very famous beach but just for fun you may want to go there....
The beach is very clean, the water is great...one can enjoy long romantic walk on this beach...or just relax... Do not miss this beach
beach is like private beach and is adjacent to hotel. it is one  of the cleanest.you  can roam freely anywhere
A nice beach, but frightening since it is a huge ocean and i remember tsunami every time i look at :))))))
can be a bit rough with a strong under toe, take notice of the red flags.  bit of a problem with sellers but just say no

The beach is facing ocean. Waves are almost always there. No guards. The sand is ok. There are wave breakers. I heard the sand is delivered to the site by trucks and wave breakers are there no not to let ocean to lick the sand off. No cleaning.  Whatever is thrown on the beach stays there. Mostly plastic and flip flops. Nobody picks the staff. So not as great from cleanness standpoint, but great from privacy standpoint. Not too many people there, while the views are great though. No infrastructure. Could be Preferred by couples. Kids only with adults waves are too big. Wave breakers are wet and slippery.

Also we found the Beach was full of rubbish which was disappointing, big piles or rubbish right outside our hotel gates as well. We spoke to the hotel manager and he sorted out a clear up team from the hotel to tidy up the mess outside our gates. We were told by the Pool Attendant that if we came a few weeks later, the Sea would be like a millpond and you could walk out for miles. There were some beautiful sunsets on the beach which was lovely. Do also expect to be bombarded by locals that hassle you and get aggressive! On the first day we went onto the beach and was straight away hassled by people trying to sell us gifts and trips. I told one person that I didn't want anything (politely) and that I wasn't sure what the plan was in terms of trips as we had literally just got there! He then called me a liar and shouted at me saying he hates liars and that I'm not a very nice person. This then made it uncomfortable for me and my family any time we wanted to go on the beach as he would be there following us around hassling us. I imagine this is a lovely beach during the Summer season but I do feel the locals and rubbish piles will always be an issue.
While in Sri Lanka a visit to beach is unavoidable. This could be one favorite spot. The clean air is distinctly felt.

Indian ocean is rough in October so swimming is not advisable. The beach itself is very nice however due to rough ocean there were lot of tree trunks and also few bottles on the beach from the nearby Black River. I can imagine if cleaned, the beach must look stunning.

We stayed at Tangerine Hotel Kalutara ,The hotel has a big garden, where you can enjoy time with your family at any time of the day. The beach is just outside the hotel and although, sea is very rough these days and not recommended for a swimming, and it is not the best beach in Srilanka so we booked an excursion with Asya tours to Galle which is located on the south cost . which has some of the best beaches in Sri lanka and has some of the best places for swimming.
Stayed for two weeks at the Avani hotel kalutara. If you are wanting to swim, this was only possible earlier morning as the current was simply too strong at day time. The sunsets are amazing.

If you are staying in Kalutara, Sri Lanka, I actually stayed in the Royal Palms Beach Hotel, if you want to do any tours I highly recommend BONI who took my mother and I on some amazing tours. He is very genuine, reliable, fully insured, trustworthy and above all cheaper than any of the tours your rep will try and sell you. There is a guy called Lucky who also works on the same beach. I would not trust or recommend this person.

Lovely beach which stretches a long way please be mindful of the waves as they come in as they may be stronger than you think, when we were there the sea was very rough and red flags were flying throughout the holiday but with the lovely pools at our hotel this was not a problem. Lots of debris was washed up daily on the beach so not the pristine beach as shown in some pictures.
Kalutara beach (near Tangarine beach hotel) is fine and lovely sand and clean..can find relaxing restaurant and hotel easily...

Beach is such a disappointment full of rubbish, stray Dogs and herd of cows we never used the beach it is one of the worst beaches I have ever seen.

Red flags for the duration of our holiday and described as having very dangerous currents. Steeply shelving and scruffy.
Lovely sandy beach, some shells and souvenir ladies. The sea was rough when we went but lovely to paddle in.

The ocean is warm but the waves are quite strong to enjoy them. We spent about two hours in water under the full moon playing in waves like children. Speaking of children- you would not want to leave them unattended in this ocean even for a minute. Waves are gentle but strong.

This beach was extremely disappointing - exceptionally dirty with rubbish and cigarette butts, as well as stray dogs pooing on the sand. Didn't seem to be cleaned at all during the two nights we were staying at a hotel looking out on to it.
Nice beach with less activities when comparing to the southern coast. But you can relax without any hassle from beach boys and scammers if your hotel has it's own beach.
The beach is clean and well cared for.  I was there in August and it was not possible to swim in the sea because of the currents but it was enough just to hear the sound of the ocean
The red "No Swim" flags were out along the coast during our 5 days in Kalutara. With the steep sweep of the sand, there was a huge undertow with a dumping wave.
Wrong time of year for the beach . We were told best time for a swim in the sea is January / February .

This area has many hotels with good service.

Lovely beaches. Could not enter the  water here it's to rough and dangerous. It is beautiful to sit in one of the beach restaurants and watch the waves crash against the  sand .. Beautiful.

quite a dangerous beach in april hard to swim because of rip tide and large waves.there was a lot of rubbish along the beach

This is not a stunning beach but has a charm of its own can get a lot of rubbish washed up on it but that is a problem everywhere now it's a nice beach to walk on enjoyed

Lovely clean beach outside Turyaa Hotel. Fabulous sunsets and very warm sea, waves can be quite rough so not ideal for swimming although as long as you keep fairly close to the shore you will be fine.

A nice artificial beach with sand and wave breakers and sun chairs and ability to rent sea sports equipment.

This is a clean beach, long with very few people. Plenty of resorts in this area along the beach. I am not sure if the beach is safe to swim. This is a beach like any other in this area. Nothing spectacular.
Amazing beautiful beach the sea was to rough to swim in but we did paddle & walked along the water edge for ages
we stayed at Kalutara for a week, the beach is just great, broad, wild, kilometers of sand and very few people.
Sand not too pebbly and beach clean. Sea very warm but can get a bit choppy with great waves but it does have rip tides. Advised by our hotel not to swim out too far.
The sea around Kalutara has under currents and we couldn't swim in it for the whole time of our holiday plus it wasn't blue like some photos show you.

clean sandy beach, excellent for walking in the morning, tanning at noon, there was no wind, but high tides!
Kalutara beach is called 'Calido' Which is a long strip of golden sand perfect for a morning or evening run.

Not for us! Beach is not the best in Sri Lanka go south! More like builders sand! Go further towards Galle

If staying at the Tangerine beach hotel the beach is just a few metres outside the grounds.Swimming when the flags are yellow/red is enjoyable.found shore line clean with no rubbish.
Beautiful and long beach on the west coast of Sri Lanka. In February the waves were most of the time very calm and the beach was nearly empty. Definitely worth a visit

love this beach and its surrounds. Its a nice place to walk along. Unfortunately the rubbish that is left behind creates a feeling of unhappiness to see such a beautiful place so disrespected. The hotels clean their areas which is lovely.

Dangerous currents, crashing breakers, sharp sand, not for the faint hearted or small children .....

Sand very gritty and we couldn't go in the sea as the red flag was always flying and we were advised it was dangerous.

Beautiful long sandy beach. Definitely not crowded. Very relaxing. Beautiful sunsets! Several restaurants along the beach. Excellent for walking.

Visited this beach for two days (Morning and Evening). In the morning very little crowd when compare to evening. Very beautiful (specially the sunset...) and clean beach, but the waves are quite strong, so be careful.
A very nice beach but unfortunately there were a lot of people trying to sell things or tours and they would not take no for answer so we had to go back to the hotel.

Nice view. But visitors put dirt near. Called Calido Beach. Good place to bath. But sometimes rough waves can be seen.

Very natural beach with fishermen fishing in the morning. Warm sea and salty ( as a sea should be) big waves and empty sands. Unfortunately hardly any sheltered area to relax, need a hotel on the beach to get the most. Coco royal is recommended !

Nice warm water, long sandy beach and hardly anyone in sight! The joys non commercialised areas to venture and explore.

The beach was disappointing - at a slope and with quite a lot of rubbish.  the sea was very rough and not suitable for swimming, but we were advised this was due to the time of year.

A quiet stretch of neat and clean beach. The sea was rough so we could not go in. No sellers on the beach. You may find some locals telling you to go into the sea saying it is safe. Do not fall for that trap.

Kalutara Beach is not what we expected. The sea is always far too rough to swim in and always has a red flag flying. There are no beach loungers or beach bars or anything to make this a friendly holiday beach to visit. Holiday's in this area are strictly reduced to pool side bathing only.
Ocean was wavy in November, but water very warm and the beach is a clean place! Good place for rest and photo sessions!

Apart from the litter, the beach looks good, but the red flag flew every day due to strong tides & waves that could knock you over in the shallows.

Enjoyed walking along the beach which had a high slope and a strong current... There are other better beaches in the area.
Extremely clean and safe beach with silver sands and beautiful views. One can walk for hours on the beach...fantastic experience for the ocean lovers
not suitable for swimming but water is warm nice to walk in Not many people around just used by two hotels and a few locals

Kalutara beach is  clean and there are no crews like in Negambo beach . We watch a dead wale on the shore that was a different kind of a experience . nice to spend time with kids . However, as there were red flags we didn't go near the  seashore

Fantastic beach. The waves of the Indian ocean are very impressive, the sound of the sea hitting against the rocks and the sore gives a relaxing feeling. A walk in the waves is an experience. If you are early you feel like on a deserted island. Robinson Crusoe feeling.

The beach outside the hotel is lovely,go 100 yds either side and full of litter,shame. The water is not safe , far too rough but is very picturesque .You will get the hawkers trying to sell but a firm polite no is respected.
A nice walk along the beach from our hotel. Not as much activity as other beaches but still a good way to get some exercise and take some good photos especially at sunset
This is one of the best beach areas, one very close to Bentota Hikkaduwa and Galle Would prefer families and couples to spend their precious time in this place, relax, love the life and enjoy

Its a nice beach but not safe to go in the sea in June.  There are quite a few guys hanging around the hotel fence that bother people as soon as they come out onto the beach. They are trying to sell their services, day trips, taxi rides etc. Can't really knock people for trying to make a living.

Only visited briefly but unimpressed dirty and unattractive, dirty water, dirty beach covered in litter

Lovely sandy beach. Was a bit rough at time of visit, but miles of lovely sand and warm water. Did have a few people pestering you on beach to try restaurants, massage, Tuk Tuks, tours etc., but not to many and not too persistent. Most locals on beach were very pleasant

This beach was in front of our hotel and i was really disappointed that we couldn't swim in the sea - there's a steep incline to the sea edge from the beach, the waves were really strong and could drag somebody out to sea easily. Nice to walk along though.
Wonderful time on the lovely beach, Crawling, dancing at the time of beautiful sun set with the team. If any one wants to relax also possible here.

Endless sand and a wonderful place,but no swimming in the sea its to rough in september so if your looking to swim in the sea this is not the place to be!

Do not expect phuket beach or bentota beach here. ... but still a nice place to enjoy the evening with the family. Kalido area is the place if you are searching for some activities like kite running, beach ball . . Street food. .

While staying at the Avani resort just walked along fot 400m and came and had a bite to eat.This was good and the friendly owner invited us to have a look at the rooms in this new small hotel.The rooms were 5* rooms at backpackers prices- I hope people will go and enjoy its on the beach location. Nice wide beach made up with shells so can be sharp in areas unfortunately when we arrived the sea was rough with strong undercurrents so you could only paddle in the sea and not swim but I was assured from December through to April it is calm and you can swim in it

The beach is littered with garbage and the nice stroll I was looking forward to was quite a disappointment. The sea was very rough and you were not able to swim aparantly you can from Nov to March. Dog mess everywhere from the street dogs. Just not the kind of beach I would have expected in Sri Lanka
I love the length of the beach for long walks and meeting the locals. Many of tracks so that you can walk into a bar/restaurant for a cool beer/coke and a meal.
Secluded beach, very rough sea near the beach but what a wonderful view of the sunset! Also can see the point where the Kalu ganga (river) flows to the Indian ocean.

Kaluthara is a Coastal area which is about 40 minutes away from Colombo city and a famous touristic beach. You can find good hotels, resorts and restaurants. Kaluthara Bodiya is another attraction in Kaluthara. Its a good beach for relax!
