On one occasion a small child ran up to me and dug his nails into my stomach really hard leaving welts and bruising. I think this was because I had not stopped to give anything to the woman he was with. This was the only bad experience I had. Mostly the sellers on the beach, although persistent are not a problem. We arranged a day trip with Lucky, one of the beach sellers outside our hotel. He took us on a river trip, then a tour of the turtle sanctuary followed by a trip to a lagoon where we could swim. He was very good and we travelled in air-conditioned comfort in a minibus. I would recommend using Lucky and understand he organises longer trips as well to Kandy and Sigiriya.

OK, so it probably isn't the locals or tourists leaving Rubbish, it is washed ashore. However, local hotels and local businesses should endeavour to clean their own area. It is getting dirty and Rubbish infested
Its just like any other beach.Nothing special about it.I stay in coastal region of india ,so this was not an offbeat experience for me.
Basically dirty with piles of rubbish, very windy and a plethora of annoying sales people, meant that beach walks were not possible. Not a beach to recommend
Lovely beach .  No swimming much of the time due to undertow.    Some people trying to sell things - can get very reasonable price    dresses, trousers, sarongs etc.

Lovely big sandy beach. The sea was too rough for swimming in July/August. Also the beach is quite steep and so it gets deep very quickly so not really good for paddling. Would be lovelier if someone cleared all the rubbish away!
Lovely beach, as the monsoon season was just finishing we were unable to swim in it as waves & undercurrent were to strong, however to go in up to knees & walk along was fab.

Hotel is situated between sea and a lagoon very beautiful view Hospitality very good, very friendly, helpful and polite staff. Chefs were very good, everyday different cuisine.  Good deals for Ayurvedic Spa and massage.
Clean beach, no crowd, strong undercurrent so not suitable to swim. Not safe for Children to play on shore

Beautiful beach but unsuitable for swimming in certain seasons. Very strong currents, we watched some locals going in to pick up driftwood but they ensured they were tied by a rope in case they needed to be pulled back in. Area outside The Royal Palms hotel was kept immaculate, the sea brings in a lot of debris which other businesses don't clean as often.
Visited in July and each day sea was rough with red flags and strong winds. Lovely to sit and watch the ocean and sunsets but not swimming. At least when we were there.Pretty clean with coarse sand.

I went in June and the sea is very rough.  Red flags out all the time I was there so no swimming allowed.  The beach outside my hotel, The Tangerine Beach was clean but quite narrow and steep.  Don't come here if you want a beach holiday.  There are beach vendors who wait at the hotel gates who constantly pester you to buy things. Because of the beach I wouldn't return to Kalutara.

Yes it's winter here and yes the waves are crashing and the red flag is out for our safety. The beach is clean and stunning we walked from the town along a beach road back to our hotel and it was a lovely relaxing walk. I can just imagine how fantastic it is to be here during Sri Lanka summer (wow).
It's winter here so it was maybe a bit expected.. Waves are big so there is no chance of swimming.. A bit dirty but other idea nice to take a walk on the beach

Rated amongst best beaches this beach is good seasonally, best times I would say is during end November till about March (sometimes in between rough). Other that these periods the sea is calm during August perhaps, stretched from Katukurunda to Waskaduwa there not many places with wide beaches however some patches like Kalido area where the beach is wide during certain months like said before, close to most hotels the beach is clean and some parts not so much, few places rocky and few deep due to estuary of the Kalu Ganga (river).. Rohan Jayamanna..

Beach is nice, quite clean, but a lot of aboriginals try to sell trips, dresses, they are a little bit annoying, but sure not dangerous and always nice, polite and pleasant. Waves was 1-2 meters high and quite strong, so we swam only once.
The beach is lovely but in June cannot swim in the sea as too rough but still found walking along the beach relaxing
sea is very rough and unable to bath or play.but other period sea is beach is very nice.clean and beautiful.

We were here at low season and it wasn't really comfortable to stay at the beach. Despite being friendly, local people were very annoying offering their services and goods. We tried some food at beach cafes but preferred to eat at the hotel.
We loved it and recommend highly for a family vacation or a honeymoon trip. Friendly staff..good food..breathtaking view of the sea will take u to another place

Want to be on the beach just alone? Kalutara beach is perfect for this...we met hardly anyone on the beach despite its next to the hotel. Clean and water really hot. Be aware of waves...it's not calm but it's fun...

Long sandy beaches, very clean, calm sensation. Sea is warm but beware as very sadden big waves come unexpectedly. Do not swim if no lifeguards around. Especially during monsoon season, even locals don't swim in sea. Can go fishing in lakes . Lots of rivers to explore by boat, be warned lots of crocodiles around. Kalutara has one of the best beaches.
The beach was lovely mostly clean but take great care the sea is very rough and although looks tempting it's not good to swim in

I have noticed that the beach here varies greatly depending on where you are accessing it from.  If you stay at a 5* hotel, then they will probably be cleaning their part thoroughly and you will be able to enjoy it.  However, some low star hotels neglect their beaches and it ends up filled with black patches and very dirty.
we enjoy our stay there just passing days in beach and pool of hotel. we love this place and will back next time for sure.

Quite a dirty and littered beach, found plastic bottles, plastic string and general litter all along this beach plus actually saw used needles which could be quite dangerous if bare footed.  It was definitely not a pleasure to walk along considering you think of golden sandy beaches with palm trees (which were non-existent) on this beach.
Pick a hotel with beach front and then you'll be able to experience more privacy and obviously a more cleaner beach that is well maintained by the hotel.

This beach is attractive and very clean. The sand is somewhat gritty and becomes very hot around mid-day. You will need shoes to walk on it. Outside the months of November to February, you are likely to find permanent red flags displayed, warning you not to swim. This is despite the fact that the water does not look particularly rough. It is a deceptive appearance. During the two weeks that we stayed in the Kalutara Avani hotel, two local people were drowned on this beach. A 28-year-old went for a swim on a full moon night and his body was found in Colombo - some 50 miles away - two days later. A week later, an 18-year-old lost his life. So, take the red flags seriously.

I'm referring to Kalido side of the beach. It's just close to the River mouth and most of the litter that float along the river washes towards this area resulting heap of garbage dumps forming along the beach. Sand is fine but parking of vehicle is not organized. No public toilets nearby. Better avoid weekends to avoid crowd.

The beach slopes steeply and it is difficult to walk along the shore. The waves were always too rough to swim in and the red flag was in place for the whole 2 weeks of our trip. The locals advise that it is rare that the sea is suitable for swimming in. Also,the tide brings in lots of plastic, which is distributed along the beach and looks very messy. It would be good if this could be collected and disposed of, perhaps by the Avani hotel that is positioned on this beach as they are also building a sister hotel next door so will have the entire shoreline by their properties and therefore it would be in their interest to improve the aesthetics of the beach.

Stayed for two weeks at the Turyaa Kalutara Hotel and spent many days on this beach and in the crystal clear warm water. If you are wanting to swim, this was only possible earlier morning as the current was simply too strong at any other time. Stunning beach, stunning scenery well worth a visit!!

A cool beach that is accesible from Avani Hotel and St Sebastian Rd. Swim on the bit between the main beach and the neighbouring one where the large stone sea break has been constructed and visit Fresh Lobsters restaurant while you are there!
holiday of a lifetime. Super hotel, every one of the staff very helpful and attentive. Try swimming in Indian ocean, amazing!!
Hi Kalutara South  beach is nice to basking in the sun and to have a sea bath. It is safe. But after thirty years war still the tourism industry coming  up. So there are many themes to develop.

We visited in April.. the beach is not for swimming as the under current is too strong but you can dip your toes.. its cleaned daily by the Avani Hotel by the staff and we lounged here blissfully for 2 days!
The beach is nice but DO NOT go in the sea. Rough with plenty of rip tides even the locals don't go in. Speaking of locals they will hound you if you do don't have a guide.
The beach was a disappointment... huge waves. very rough sea. cant swim in it. too dangerous. I had to travel away to find water that was swimmable. Also had to go south to find the prettier beaches.
Clean beach and water.  No privacy, plenty of people stick to you to sell you something. Really annoying!

This beach is a beautiful spot but is very steep and so  realy  for  children friendly and there is a strong undertow in the afternoon so it can be quite dangerous. The sand also gets very hot where the water doesnt reach so flip flops are essential.

This is a lovely long sandy beach. If you want to swim then it is best to do so in the morning, as after midday the back tide is quite strong. There is quite a lot of rubbish washed up, so it could do with a bit of a clean up. Overall it is good though.
Fun time on a clean and sandy beach. The water was choppy the day we visited, but still had a great time there. We stayed at the Citrus Waskaduwa which was about 2 km away.

Pretty beach but with a fairly featureless ocean view - no islands etc to look at.  Beware of the strong currents, we were swept of our feet just paddling distance in, landed on our knees and emerged bleeding from lots of tiny cuts from the very coarse and coral/shell filled sand
Not good for swim and full of garbage around. Black and muddy looking water. Unawatuna and mirrissa is the only beach which can rate in 4 stars.
On beach front hotel. Beach very clean, have swam a few times and water is clean. Plenty of beach side restaurants, bars etc
The beach is lovely, but the sea is very rough and unsuitable for safe swimming. As the hotels front the beach there are no amenities on the beach itself.

Unlike the beaches further north such as Wadduwa this is a very clean beach and nice and wide too.  As many places on this coast the currents can get very strong at certain times of the day so watch out for the red flags.

A lovely beach for a long morning or evening stroll although the sea is rough with strong currents therefore unsafe to swim. There are lots of beach hawkers who are very persistent in selling their wares which at times can be slightly intimidating. There are also a couple of beach bars and restaurants.
I like that how people come and enjoy here. It was a place both river and sea connect and that temple view is amazingly see from there

Kalutara beach is long sandy beach with golden sand.It is very clean.Water is quite warm even in the evening. It's sloping in the water. On our early morning walks, we found so many beautiful sea shells. we were warn about strong undercurrents, so swimmers would be disappointed but we had fun paddling in knee deep water and loved long walks on the beach.
So beautiful and clean and very fresh air! I enjoyed taking long walks in both directions! Felt very much like true paradise!
Location is not well maintained by local authority. No basic facilities for visitors. No life guard service. No lighting.
the beach is nice and clean. not many local vendors around to pester you, so one can enjoy his time at the beach and relax.

Kalutara beach near the mermaid hotel is a orange colour sand and the waves are quite strong. You can walk out 50 metres and only be thigh high but the waves are strong. My 9 and 14 year old sons loved it. But please be aware some days can be quite rough. The locals know what they are talking about so always ask them if it's a good day to go in it. Take no notice of the red flags that are up as they are always up. I would never ever let my kids go out further than waist high and me and their dad was ALWAYS with them but waist high is still quite far out but safe. We had such a great time there
Super! But not for swimming. There is you can feel strong Ocean energy.  Beautiful sunsets.  A lot of beach restaurants there with fresh sea food, including langousts

Not the widest of beaches but relavtivly clean. A few sellers on the beach but thet will go away when told you are not interested. Not a good place to swim as there is a strong under current, red flag often out.
This is a nice,long beach quite clean- very clean outside the main hotels- ideal for long, energetical walks early in the morning.
Beach clean which makes a change. No problems on beach but then one would not go on pat dark. Lovely to sit with a G n T and watch the sun go down. Recommended
... fine for a walk, a dip in the sea. The currents are strong so caution needs to be exercised. The sand is coarse and dark in places, and there isn't really anywhere you'd want to lie and sunbathe.

A really relaxing trip to Kalutara Beach arranged by Mango Lanka tours. Bob, the tour guide, was helpful and easy to be with and our visit was enhanced by his help. Thank you. I recommend Kalutara Beach and Mango Lanka tours Mick Wood
you can not swim in this part of the beach as the under currants are extremely dangerous even for paddling
Great beach overall but watch out for the rip current. The only draw back was the mass quantity of people selling stuff on the beach. It always worried us about leaving things on the beach.

The coastline is a continuous long beach of yellow Sands,  fishing boats, dogs, cows, birds and people but unfortunately, the sea has strong currents.  So beware.   Don't go in too deposit and don't go in after drinking, be careful.
I was dissapointed that the beach was not only steep with very strong waves but hardly any where that had shade or somewhere to get a drink. We used the area in front of the Tangerine Hotel.

I was so surprised to find such lovely beaches in North Kalutara/ Waskaduwa/Wadduwa areas! I was travelling much further south to Galle and beyond, but find these beaches just 40 km from Colombo to be fantastic! The surf boards are out, and the swimming in shallow waters during this season is at least as good as anywhere I've been in Sri Lanka over the past 6 years. Plus the little hotels, shops and eating spots between Royal Palms and the new Coco Royal suit our quiet lifestyle superbly!
Strong undertows and quite large waves mean this beach is only for good swimmers and there is no prospect of snorkelling!

We loved walks along the beach here.  The beaches are quite steep though, with strong currents in places and impressive waves and sunset.  It also gets very hot underfoot during the middle of the day, so you can't stand on one spot for too long in places!

The beach is very nice but their is quite a bit of litter at the top of the beach as there is everywhere. The sea is lovely and warm but I would advise that only strong swimmers venture out further than a few yards as there is a very strong under current. Just wandering along the shore beach combing collecting lovely shells is relaxing enough.
visit this place and you will be attracted to Sri Lanka. Friendly people are there  and you can have a safe tour

nice beach fairly clean, nice for collecting shells and you don't get hassled by people selling things, but not good for swimming as there is a strong under current . There's also a selection of bar's and restaurants some also offer massage's .

This beach could have been so great.. We have been told by the owner of our hotel that the gouvernment does not want to rebuild the kalutara beach.. The beach is now full of rubbish, debris, dogs and cows :/ not a very nice place to work on your tan The water is nice and warm though

The beach looks beautiful but has s steep incline into the sea.  Current is very strong and not suitable for paddling.  Walking up the beach there was quite a lot of rubbish and dogs and cows wander across.  Beware of animal urination.

The beach was lovely but the sea has a strong under current to it. We were advised not to go above the knee, but with the waves you could swim a little or mess about in the waves. You just have to remember you are soon further down the beach quicker than you realise if you are not careful. People do approach you to sell trips or goods but we found if we politely said no thanks nd walked away they left us

Nice stretch of beach - some rubbish in areas but pristine outside hotels. Beware the boys touting for excursions. The sand gets very hot and the sea is very rough in places.  The swell is so strong it means you can walk out 3 metres and be up to your shoulders in water in these dips ( but a metre further out and you're back to waist height in water). I didn't feel comfortable swimming there and as there is little shade I think this is a great place to get some serious sunburn!
Silky soft sand - just like walking on silk!  So relaxing and clean with a gentle breeze at times which eases up the sun factor now & then (Visited Feb 2007)
A beauty place but it needs to be cleaned up. A lot of garbish and locals who push you to buy or go for adventures or restaurants. Glass pieces at the beach are extremely dangerous.
Not a good beach to pass time, rocky, sudden slopes. large size sand particles. rough beach in total.
Beach is pretty narrow and has a mixture of light and dark sand. There is no interesting bars/cafes. The views are quite average after being spoiled by other srilankan locations.
The sand is a little coarse,you will meet a few locals while you are walking along.they are very polite and are just trying to earn a buck so no need for you to be rude.

The Beauty of the beach is beach is because of Kalu Ganga (River). The sand bank between River and Sea run around 2 to 3 KM. In Sri Lanka this is the only place which you can have this kind of experience.

Good clean beach for walking and swimming in, beware of the locals tho who would try sell u their souls for some rupee. Very few restaurants and massage places dotted along it and the sand can be gravelly in place making it rough on bare feet at times.
beach can be nice if someone will take care of, bit of cleanup and no more garbage on fires will help a lot.

This is a really lovely beach and you can catch some fantastic sunsets here. The tides are incredibly strong so you do have to go careful if you do go into the sea and i would certainly suggest you do not go in alone as there are not many lifeguards about. There are  a few stray dogs about particulary in the evening so if you are not a dog person you have been warned. Also there is the usual beach boys hanging around who will approach you and recommend tours etc. If you are not interested just politely say no and they will generally listen. However if you are interested i would recommend you speak to Suresh who is fantastic and pretty reasonable.

A long, wide beach fringed by palm trees. Sounds divine except it's a deep yellow with lots of black patches and rubbish that washes up. Lots of locals on the beach who want to talk to you about trips or using local restaurants etc so not the place for a romantic stroll. The sea was very rough throughout the time I was there. Rips are apparently a problem so keep an eye on gaps in the waves.

The beach is long for walks in the morning or evenings, with a lots of opportunities to take nice photos of sunset in sunny days. There are few restaurants along side of the beach and beach boys to offer you trips for good price. The way to the sea is bit slope down and waves can be a little bit big, but once you are in it all is good. The sea is bit rough to swim in, but is ok to just get in and cool of in hot sunny days. Once you are in don't go to far, because of strong currents. Water is nice and warm. Best is to come down before sunset and just watch sun go down with sound of the waves crushing on the sand. The beach is not very clean a times, but locals do everything to keep it tidy.

As with most beaches in Sri Lanka this is a public beach and whilst it's great for leisurely strolls or just standing by the water and watching the sea, as with other beaches in the area the sea is too rough to swim in. It's still nice though, you do get a few stray dogs and people selling things but nothing too bad, overall it's a good beach for short walks but I'd stick to your hotel pool and garden area.

Kalutara Beach is really very long, but it has two defects. First, the sand is very soft, and walking becomes tiring after a while, after 10 a.m it is quite impossible to walk on the "hard side" of the beach because it gets very very hot. Second, except the beach in front of the hotel, it is not very clean. I don't know if that depends on the sea which has always big waves, or on  the humans who throw on the beach bottles and other materials.
long golden sandy beaches, down south of sri lanka and in this area there lot of things to see and chill out.

A wonderful experience here in Kalutara. Easy access to the beach with wonderful sunsets, although the sand is gritty as opposed to soft. Don't be afraid to use the local "beach touts" who offer trips. Many are fishermen who lost their home and livelihood in the tsunami and haven't yet got it back, so make money where they can. They are genuine, honest people in our experience. The fish market is well worth a tuk-tuk ride from outside the hotel ¬£3 for a whole morning use with driver/guide.

Lovely beach, very quiet, lots of wildlife about. Fruitbats, cows !! - yes cows. A Crocodile - although this is a rarity... it escaped the Black River during a big rain downfall. A lot of locals, all very friendly and charming.
Mostly crowded and well known area among lovers..its amazing if you can reach to the 'Moya' the place where the river connecting to the Indian ocean..
nice long beach to walk along,people will stop to chat to you,but just carrying on walking and they will stop.you may well come across a few cows on the beach first thing in the mornings..
This beach was amazing! Some may think this odd, because we did, but cows walk on the beach here. I think my mouth actually dropped when I saw the first cow walking down the beach.

The beach is very nice, once you overcome all the sellers that will harass you , if you dont know how to fend them off, They will first ask you if this is your first trip to Sri Lanka, ALWAYS answer no I have been before then they will ask if you have done any trips ALWAYS answer Yes we've done them all (even if you haven't) If you are tempted to buy their wares always start at least 40% lower than the price they start when haggling you will then get a proper price to pay. After a while you will be able to walk on the Beach freely, Please bear in mind if the RED FLAG is flying do not enter the sea, as there is a very strong undercurrent.
beach cleaned daily by hotel staff, watch out for local peddlers trying to sell you goods, water can be very rough
Fabulous sandy beach.  But beware of the rip tide currents.  Spectacular sun sets when it is not cloudy.

A long sandy beach that is very dangerous to swim in. Even paddling is not safe as a big wave will catch you unawares and the undertow is incredible. Permanent red flags while we were there. Beach sellers can be a bit of a pain. Still worth seeing though.
Coarse sand. Dangerous rough sea with strong undertow. Beach shelves off quickly into deep water. I would suggest children are kept well clear of the waterline.

Because of the steepness of the beach and the very strong under currents it was not a safe place to swim. You should definitly not go there alone and under no circumstances allow children in.. The beach vendors are a pest but it is their way of making a living

The beach is very dirty. Some hotels clean the part of the beach next to them but mostly there is garbage on the beach. There are local people trying to sell you their goods and offering services (tour guides, sea food restaurants, massages), lots of crabs. The ocean is quite rough and you can't swim in it.
it was a bit rough as its not the right season... but you could still enjoy the beautiful .. long clean beaches here....
Interesting area to explore and very helpful local people. The local shops provides unusual yet interesting value for money goods.

Nice to walk down. Do get accosted by a little by the beach boys but they are not really a problem, if your not interested in the trips joust say no and they will leave you alone. Not good for swimming, go further  south for that.

The water maybe isn't the nicest clearest colour in Sri Lanka but the beach is smooth and sandy and the water warm. In August there are exciting large waves so it's fun to go in the shallows in the water. However, I would give this beach five stars if not for the huge amounts of rubbish which spoil the beach. Local hotels should join forces to clean it up.
The beach is not well kept as public beach also strong undercurrents make it unusable to swim needs cleaning up

Dirty & untidy beach once you get past the Tangerine Beach & Royal Beach Hotel area. Sea is rough & not suitable for children or weak swimmers. Also large number of semi feral dogs along the beach, which although appear friendly, can be intimidating
Not a safe beach as the current is very strong.  Has a cool breeze most of the time and is not busy.  Worth a visit

It was a good beach but unfortunately due to the fact that it was monsoon season we were unable to go into the water as the waves were fierce and strong undercurrents. Plenty of stuff washed up on beach, some interesting but alas a lot of rubbish.
Needs to be kept cleaner - sea roungh during summer months but lovely and warm. Be brave and let yourself get dunked, ask the locals to help you stay safe

very peaceful place , from one side you can see the Indian Ocean and from other side KALU river, and close to Kalu river you can see the very beautiful and calming view of Kalutara Bodiya and Watadageya (Kalutara Buddhist Temple)
Its all about individuals. We love this place, I suppose the beach could do with cleaning daily, but overall its ideal
The sea is very rough, and the beach has loads of rubbish on it. The Hotels seem to clean there bits of beach and dump it somewhere else. Local sellers on the beach pester you.

nice beach, but the sea was very rough with heavy current, even for very good confident swimmers it can be dodgy, was a little disappointing as I like to swim in the sea and the red flag is up all year around, we ended up just sitting down on the beach with the water coming over us, but certainly then you had to have your wits about you.. nice walks though.

Beach was lovely but as it was monsoon sea very rough but we could have a paddle not able to swim, but lifeguards on hand to advise you not to go in the sea. Although we did see some people in the sea swimming but I thought it was not advisable

The sea here is very rough and as a result the red flag is up all year round. You swim at your own risk. However you can still have fun, sitting at the waters edge and letting the waves wash over you. Even doing this the ride tries to drag you out though. It's still a beautiful beach to behold!
very beautiful beach we have ever seen ....we  had  enjoyable  time ..every free time  we hope  to  come..
nice beach with good hotels around. peacful and very long. with a few restaurant on the beach. be careful of bathing during high tide
The beach isn't crowded, dirty. The absence of commercial joints makes this a place to really laze around or play in the waves.
There are other much nicer beaches a tuk tuk drive away. The beach was dirty and looked a bit desolate
One of the best please to enjoy with friends to take change/refresh our normal life style with love and fun.
The beach is every morning clean, nice to run two - three kilometers far, a lot of cheap restaurants, sea is not for swimming, every day big waves
Nice Beach we had fun it was like a private beach we were surprised about it. cos only less  were there the day that we went ofcourse it was a holiday. yet it was like a private beach and very clean.

Nice and beautiful beach to visit. There's several ayurveda spas near to beach. And tasty foods also available in the restaurants.. But it's not very good place to swim.most of time sea is rough in this area.. Better to check with lifeguards before you swim. But in Sunset, it's really beautiful and romantic to view..
Relaxe pure, lovely people, amazing nature, interesting sights, healthy food, ajurvedic experience, beautiful empty beaches
We were there 10 days and could never swim. The beach is very prety but the sea is rough and always red flag. Perhaps it's better during dry season.

The each is very marrow with a sharp decline to the sea. The sand is not exactly silky smooth, more the sharp type used in building. The sea is very rough with strong undercurrents and is not suitable for swimming.

The beach looks beautiful and the water is lovely and warm. Not that suitable for young kids as waves can be quite rough. The water isnt deep but waves knocked me off my feet a good few times ! Few dogs about which seemed to be with the beach boys / women. The women a sold sarongs and helped you tie them. Beach boys were helpfull too. Went to shops on tut tut with Ravy. They all  didnt hassle you which was nice. Only down side plastic getting washed onto beach. Scurge of the world is plastic
The beach isn't nice. It is dirty and it is qnot good to walk, no nice sand. The ocean is very rough.

Sandy beach sloping sharply down to water.  You can swim close to shore but beware of currents further out.  Waves can catch you unaware so don't wear your glasses, unless you want to lose them (guess who wishes someone who told her that!).

It isn't the sort of town to browse around for long it's a third world country so the shops are mainly for locals,but if you need a supermarket try Arpico or Cargills they are air conditioned and stock most items one would need.
Lovely beach, very quiet, local fishman around, sometimes sea can be rough so caution should be taken, great for a morning walk for at least an hour on all along the coast line

Had very plesent stay at this graceful hotel,always clean and food prepered with a passion.Staff greet you with a smile and always ready to please.Easy to get out and about.Great location,sea warm and clean.I love Shir Lanka.

Our Hotel (Tangerine) backed on to Kalutara Beech. Golden sand and warm sea. Some days the sea currents could be dangerous. Hotel Life guard flagged this up. Best time for swim was early morning (if you were a competent swimmer)
Great beach, good having a lifeguard present. Nearly always possible to swim.Nice to see the cows wandering about late afternoon

Get bartering with the ladies or paddle in the sea! =) A lovely beach in a beautiful country. Watch the fishermen leave and come in,or just bathe on the beach under the Sri Lankan sun. The sunsets are amazing!
Vast Beach and never busy. Beautiful views , a bit choppy to swim in sea. The Local Beach vendors are harmless and a polite, no, and they will leave you alone.

The beach is beautiful with sand and trees at the waters edge. Fishing boats go out to sea regularly. BUT there is a very strong under current so it is really not safe for children and inexperienced swimmers

The beach at Kalutara is very narrow and shelves steeply into the sea, which can be quite rough and it is not advisable to swim unless the hotel lifeguards are on duty.  The beach can become a bit of a mess at times with a herd of cows using it morning and afternoon to get to their grazing area and back.  The Tangerine hotel staff have a very serious clean, I think on the third Friday each month when they clean the area in front of the hotel, but if you walk towards Kalutara, there is a lot of rubbish washed up by the sea and the locals are not the best at taking their litter home. The beaches on the south and east of the island are much better
Red flags fly, so be careful in water. Many dogs, so don't get toxacara. Vendors soon leave you alone if your'e not interested. BUT - the sunsets, when not raining are amazing. Take a camera/phone.
Kalutara beach is not good for swimming, mostly because of streams, water is brownish coulored ind the sand on the beach is poluted.
nice long sandy beach, however the locals say there are strong under currents and advise against swimming as you are liable to be swept along the beach

We've grown up with blue flag beaches in our home town and where we have our holiday home in South Africa. So, our standards for beaches are quite high. But, having lived in the Middle East, give me a clean beach with sand and waves and I'm happy. I swam in this but we got a rash from the dirty water. Water so brown you can't see your body below the surface. between that and the currents I didn't allow my kids to swim (and we are all good swimmers).
